Abd al-Samad said: Hammad ibn Hayyan al-Attardi al-Khayyat (the shoemaker) narrated to me, and I did not see him except blind. Jafar ibn Sa'd ibn Ubaidullah al-Kahili: regarding his father and Salam al-Kahili, Abd al-Jabbar ibn Abbas and Marwan ibn Mu'awiyah narrated from him. hadiths.english_translation: Ali narrated to us: Ya'qub ibn Ibrahim ibn Sa'd narrated to us, he said: My father narrated to us, from Salih, from Abu Ubaidah, he said: Talhah ibn Abdullah ibn Awf informed me, and from a son of Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, that his father narrated to him: 'The Prophet ﷺ exerted himself on the Night of the Jinn, until he went out of the houses, while he was in Makkah. Then he drew a line and said: "Sit and do not separate." He was asked: "Who are these whom you heard speaking to you?" He said: "The delegation of the jinn of the Peninsula."' It is not known that Talhah heard from Ibn Abdullah. And Musa narrated to us: Wuhaib narrated to us, from Dawud, from Amir, from Alqamah, he said: I said to Abdullah ibn Mas'ud: 'Who of you was with the Prophet ﷺ on the Night of the Jinn?' He said: 'None of us was with him. We missed him one night in Makkah and we said: "He was assassinated or taken away." We went looking for him in the valleys. He came from the direction of Hira. We said: "We were worried about you, and we spent the worst night." He said: "A caller from the jinn came to me, so I went to recite to them." And there were their traces and traces of their fires.' Shu'bah said: From Amr ibn Murrah, he said: I said to Abu Ubaidah: 'Was your father with the Prophet ﷺ on the Night of the Jinn?' He said: 'No.' And Amr ibn Murrah said: From Abdullah ibn Salamah, from Abdullah: 'I was with the Prophet ﷺ on the Night of the Jinn' - and this is not authentic. Also includes a biographical entry about Ja'far ibn al-Mu'addal.

hadiths.english_translation: Musaddad told us: From Abu Awanah, from al-A'mash, from Abu Sufyan, from Jabir, he said: 'I used to provide water to my companions on the day of Badr.' [Second chain] And Abdullah ibn Abi al-Aswad told me, from Humayd ibn al-Aswad, from Hajjaj al-Sawwaf, he said: Abu al-Zubayr narrated to me, from Jabir, that he narrated to them, he said: 'The Prophet (peace be upon him) participated in twenty-one military expeditions himself, I witnessed nineteen expeditions.'
